result.execSummary:
The defendant Clyde S. Warner Sr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Cash bond applied; partial refund;  sg /mg   ck#22CH091015
DE left voicemail for Branch 6 clerk regarding bond and fees/cost owed. Clerk NN attempted to call DE; no answer and left voicemail advising DE how to contact the finance department.
on Petition for Appointment of Attorney - DENIED; defendant chose to represent himself. (Copy mailed to party)

3:09 PM Attorney Daniel Joseph Tombasco in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Clyde S. Warner Sr. in court. Clerk N. Nobile.
MINUTES: Victim rights compliance. The matter is resolved. Discussion held. On State's motion the domestic abuse enhancer on count 2 is stricken from the record. Defendant entered a plea of guilty to count 2; found guilty by the court. On motion of the State, count 1 is dismissed and read in. Sentencing arguments heard. Defendant is sentenced to 30 days KCJ w/Huber-ELM; 1 day credit; deft to report to jail on 10/1/2022 at 8am. Court costs and DNA surcharge ordered, 90 days to pay or civil judgment. Defendant is ordered to submit a DNA sample; written notice provided to defendant in court. Appeal Rights given.

from Victim Clyde W. Jr.
Forwarded to Branch 6

and Proposed Order.
Sent to Br 6.

records.addlTxt: PE FOR APPT OF ATTY PAPERWORK PLACED IN CRML CLRKS BIN

09:52 AM   Attorney Dan Tombasco appeared for the State. Defendant, Clyde S. Warner, appeared.  Clerk N. Nobile.
MINUTES:   Victim rights compliance. DE states he would like to proceed pro se today. State put the offer on the record. DE does not accept offer at this time and requests an adjournment. Court adjourns.  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 22, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
No disposition. Leave on for next scheduled court activity.
re: Judicial Rotation on 8/1/22 mailed to DE

PROPER ATTIRE REQUIRED.  NO SHORTS OR TANK TOPS ALLOWED IN COURTROOM.
Continued posted
  *Not to Possess or Consume Alcohol.  *Not To Possess or Consume Controlled Substances w/o a Prescription.  No VIOLENT contect and no discussion of case with Peter P & Clyde W Jr.

02:24 PM   Attorney Zachary Brost appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  The Court finds probable cause in this case today.  Def. is referred to the Public Defender.  If not eligible, def. to retain his own counsel. Court date will not be adjourned due to def.'s failure to retain counsel.  Plea of Not Guilty entered by the Court.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 29, 2022 at 01:40 pm.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 31, 2022 at 09:30 am.. $650 Cash bond continued posted w/conditions (see previous bond entry). rb
